I have written explanatory design docs for ChainRules that explain why `rrule` returns a closure, and why it lets you redefine how the primal is computed.
The PR is here:
<https://github.com/JuliaDiff/ChainRulesCore.jl/pull/282>

and you can look and the rendered preview here:
<https://www.juliadiff.org/ChainRulesCore.jl/previews/PR282/design/changing_the_primal.html>
Feedback would be appreciated

two things i think that make this good

Firstly:
It does the:
Show them the locked door before showing them the key.
Where we construct up to `rrule` by successively demonstrating and fixing problems with simpler things.

Secondly it has a bunch of completely real examples of why.
Which is nice cos when we wrote the code to be that way we kind of only had theoretical examples.
